Column Comment.0: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: the type of production entity may be equal to oneof the table names of the PDEN subtype tables, such as PDEN_WELL,PDEN_COUNTY or PDEN_FIELD. Validated by check constraint.
Column Comment.1: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.4: WELL REPORTING STREAM PARTICIPATION OBSERVATION NUMBER: Thissequencer is used to allow a row in the WELL table to participate in a Well ReportingStream more than once over time, or to have more than one role in a Well ReportingStream at the same time.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL shouldbe created.
Column Comment.9: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.10: SUBSTANCE IDENTIFER: Identify the substance from a row in the well table that isparticipating in the Well Reporting Stream.
Column Comment.11: SUBSTANCE PERCENT: the percent of this substance that is participating in theWell Reporting Stream.
Column Comment.12: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.14: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.16: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
